creator: Gregory of Nyssa
description:
LibriVox recording of Funeral Oration on Meletius by Gregory of Nyssa. (Translated by William Moore.)
Read in English by A LibriVox Volunteer
Saint Meletius was Patriarch of Antioch from 360 until his death in 381. One of his last acts was to preside over the First Council of Constantinople in 381. Saint Gregory of Nyssa, his brother, Saint Basil the Great, and Saint Gregory Nazianzus were known as the Cappadocian Fathers. Saint Gregory was in attendance at the First Council of Constantinople, during which Meletius reposed, and gave the eulogy at the latter's funeral. - Summary by The Reader
For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording.

For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org.
subject: librivox; audiobooks;saint gregory of nyssa; saint meletius of antioch; funeral orations
title: Funeral Oration on Meletius
